entities.description: "Jason Weston is one of the researchers involved in the development of the Retrieve and Refine model for dialogue sequence generation."
"Emily Dinan is one of the researchers involved in the development of the Retrieve and Refine model for dialogue sequence generation."
"Alexander H. Miller is one of the researchers involved in the development of the Retrieve and Refine model for dialogue sequence generation."
"Facebook AI Research is the organization where Jason Weston, Emily Dinan, and Alexander H. Miller work and conduct research on sequence generation models for dialogue."

A chit-chat task dataset used to evaluate dialogue models, aimed at getting to know the other speaker's profile. It is also the challenge task where the Retrieve and Refine model showed superior performance in human evaluations compared to standard retrieval and generation models.
"The development and proposal of the Retrieve and Refine model to combine the advantages of retrieval and sequence generation models in dialogue tasks."
"RetrieveNRefine, or RetNRef, is the model proposed by the researchers, which involves retrieving a response and then refining it using a sequence generator."
"RetrieveNRefine+ is a variant of the RetrieveNRefine model where the dialogue history is truncated to pay more attention to the retrieval utterance."
"RetrieveNRefine++ is a variant of the RetrieveNRefine model that exactly copies the retrieval if the model generates with large word overlap, otherwise leaves the generation untouched."
"Seq2Seq is a sequence generation model used in the Retrieve and Refine model, which is a 2-layer LSTM with attention."
"Key-Value Memory Network is used as the retriever in the Retrieve and Refine model, attending over the dialogue history to learn input and candidate retrieval embeddings."
"ParlAI is the platform where the code for both the Seq2Seq model and the Key-Value Memory Network used in the Retrieve and Refine model is available."
"Perplexity is a measure used to evaluate the performance of different types of retrievers for the RetNRef model on the ConvAI2 task test set."

relationships.description: "Jason Weston is a researcher at Facebook AI Research."
"Emily Dinan is a researcher at Facebook AI Research."
"Alexander H. Miller is a researcher at Facebook AI Research."
"The Retrieve and Refine model was evaluated and showed superior performance in the CONVAI2 challenge task."
"Retrieve and Refine model is also known as RetrieveNRefine or RetNRef, which is the proposed model for dialogue tasks."
"RetrieveNRefine+ is a variant of the Retrieve and Refine model."
"RetrieveNRefine++ is a variant of the Retrieve and Refine model."
"Seq2Seq is used as the sequence generator in the RetrieveNRefine model."
"Key-Value Memory Network is used as the retriever in the RetrieveNRefine model."
"The code for the Seq2Seq model is available in ParlAI."
"The code for the Key-Value Memory Network is available in ParlAI."
"Perplexity is used to measure the performance of different types of retrievers for RetNRef on the ConvAI2 task test set."

entities.description: A chit-chat task dataset used to evaluate dialogue models, aimed at getting to know the other speaker's profile. It is also the challenge task where the Retrieve and Refine model showed superior performance in human evaluations compared to standard retrieval and generation models.
"PersonaChat is a dataset used in the ConvAI2 challenge, where crowdworkers engage in conversations while portraying assigned personas."
"Zhang et al., 2018 refers to the authors of a paper that introduced the Memory Network approach for retriever models in conversational AI."
"Memory Network is a model approach used for retriever models in conversational AI, mentioned as the best performing existing retriever model."
"RetNRef is a model that improves upon Seq2Seq models by using retrieval methods to generate more human-like responses in conversational AI."
"RetNRef++ is a variant of the RetNRef model that truncates dialogue history and focuses more on the retrieval utterance to improve perplexity."
"Seq2Seq is a standard model used in conversational AI that generates responses without the use of retrieval methods."
"RetrieveNRefine++ is a variant of the RetNRef model that copies the retrieval if the model generates with large word overlap, aiming to improve the output."
"1155 personas represent the number of possible personas created by a set of workers for the conversational dataset used in ConvAI2."
"Crowdworkers are individuals who participate in the creation of the dataset for ConvAI2 by acting as personas and engaging in conversations."
"2000 dialogues refer to the number of dialogues used for validation and test in the ConvAI2 dataset, utilizing non-overlapping personas."
"160,000 utterances indicate the total number of utterances present in the ConvAI2 dataset across approximately 11,000 dialogues."
"11,000 dialogues represent the total number of dialogues in the ConvAI2 dataset, each involving conversations between crowdworkers."
"Liu et al., 2016 refers to the authors of a paper that discusses the difficulty of evaluating dialogue systems with automated metrics."
"Perplexity Dialogue is the challenge of evaluating dialogue systems, which is known to be hard due to the many valid answers with little word overlap."
"Word Statistics is a method used to measure the salience of a generation model by comparing it to human utterances in terms of word frequency and use."
"Word overlap is a metric used to measure the similarity between retrieved and generated sentences in RetNRef variants to evaluate model performance."

relationships.description: "ConvAI2 challenge dataset uses a modified version of the PersonaChat dataset for its conversations."
"The ConvAI2 dataset references the work of Zhang et al., 2018, particularly the Memory Network approach for retriever models."
"The Memory Network approach is used as the basis for the RetNRef model's retriever method in conversational AI."
"RetNRef++ is a variant of the RetNRef model, indicating a direct relationship and improvement upon the original model."
"RetNRef is compared to Seq2Seq as an improvement over the standard Seq2Seq model in conversational AI."
"RetrieveNRefine++ is a variant of the RetNRef model, indicating a direct relationship and an attempt to refine the original model's approach."
"ConvAI2 dataset consists of conversations between crowdworkers who were asked to act as personas and chat naturally."
"The ConvAI2 dataset involves crowdworkers acting as personas, with 1155 possible personas created for this purpose."
"The challenge of Perplexity Dialogue is discussed by Liu et al., 2016, who highlight the difficulty of evaluating dialogue systems with automated metrics."
"Word Statistics is used to analyze and compare the performance of the RetNRef model against human utterances in terms of word frequency and use."
"Word overlap is used to measure the similarity between retrieved and generated sentences in the RetNRef variants to evaluate the model's reliance on the retriever."

entities.description: "Person 1 is a participant in the dialogue who enjoys sprite, goes on hikes with a pet parrot named Tasha, and identifies as a lactoovo vegetarian and vegan."
"Person 2 is a participant in the dialogue, represented by the RetNRef++ model, who likes Dr. Pepper, expresses a wish to have a parrot, and identifies as vegan."
"RetNRef++ is a model used in the dialogue that shows improved engagement quality by referencing conditioned retrieved sentences and has a higher win rate against other models."
"Memory Network model is a retriever model that RetNRef++ obtains statistically significant wins against, with a win rate of approximately 54%."
"Seq2Seq model is a generator model that RetNRef++ outperforms with a win rate of approximately 54%."
"Dr. Pepper is a beverage mentioned in the dialogue as a favorite of Person 2."
"Sprite is a beverage mentioned in the dialogue as a favorite of both Person 1 and Person 2."
"Nissan Sentra is a car model mentioned in the text as being owned by Person 2."
"Tasha is Person 1's pet parrot, mentioned as accompanying them on hikes."
"RetNRef is an earlier version of the model that is part of the comparison in the study, with RetNRef++ showing improvements over it."
"A/B tests are experiments conducted to compare RetNRef against humans, showing a higher win rate for RetNRef."
"Retrieval models are a type of model used to improve generation models in dialogue, as discussed in the conclusion of the text."
"Generation models are a type of model in dialogue systems that can be improved by retrieval models, as mentioned in the conclusion."
"Human judgments are used to evaluate the quality of conversations provided by the RetNRef++ model, indicating it provides more engaging conversations."
"Concatenation plus attention is a method used in some models that the text suggests could be improved for better results in dialogue systems."
"Independent sources refers to treating the inputs as separate entities in model training, suggested as a potential area for future improvement in dialogue systems."
"Joint training of models is proposed as a possible sophisticated approach for improving results in dialogue systems."

relationships.description: "Person 1 and Person 2 engage in a dialogue, sharing their preferences and experiences, such as their favorite beverages and dietary choices."
"Person 1 is engaged in a dialogue with the RetNRef++ model, which is represented by Person 2 in the conversation."
"Person 2 is an embodiment of the RetNRef++ model in the dialogue, showing its capabilities in generating engaging and relevant responses."
"RetNRef++ outperforms the Memory Network model in dialogue generation with a win rate of approximately 54%."
"RetNRef++ outperforms the Seq2Seq model in dialogue generation with a win rate of approximately 54%."
"Person 1 owns Tasha, their pet parrot, and takes her on hikes."
"RetNRef++ is an improved version of the RetNRef model, with a higher win rate against other models."
"RetNRef is compared to the Memory Network model, showing improvements in the RetNRef++ version."
"RetNRef is compared to the Seq2Seq model, with RetNRef++ showing improvements over both."
"RetNRef++ is evaluated against humans in A/B tests, showing a higher win rate."
"Retrieval models are used to improve generation models in dialogue, as indicated in the conclusion."
"RetNRef++ is evaluated by human judgments and is considered to provide more engaging conversations."
"Concatenation plus attention is a method used in retrieval models that could be improved, as suggested in the text."
"Retrieval models may benefit from treating inputs as independent sources, a concept mentioned as a potential area for future work."
"Joint training is proposed as a method to improve retrieval models, as mentioned in the conclusion."

entities.description: "Chia-Wei Liu is an author of the paper 'How not to evaluate your dialogue system: An empirical study of unsupervised evaluation metrics for dialogue response generation'."

"RetNRef++ is an improved model that uses a retriever and can generate novel content, outperforming standard retrievers."
"Zhang et al. (2018) established a protocol for human evaluation of dialogue models, which is followed in this text."
"Seq2Seq is a model compared to RetNRef variants, found to be inferior in terms of engagement."
"Memory Network Retriever is a model that outperforms Seq2Seq in terms of engagement."
"RetNRef is a model that RetNRef++ conditions on and slightly outperforms, showing superior engagingness scores."
"Human Judgement Scores is an evaluation method where humans conduct dialogues with models and score various aspects like engagingness and consistency."
"A/B Testing by Humans is a method used to statistically evaluate models by comparing their performance in dialogues."
"Person 1 is a participant in the example dialogues, providing statements and engaging with the RetNRef++ model."
"Person 2 represents the RetNRef++ model in the example dialogues, responding to Person 1's statements."
